pros: 98% of coworkers are great, scheduling coordinator works hard to accommodate everyone's PTO/school/personal life needs.

pros: The House Supervisors and Unit Shift Supervisors are nice, understanding, helpful, and way to lenient on their staff's behavioral problems. The unit managers are awesome and way too nice. They all try to be flexible with their staff's schedule.
cons: Unfortunately, most of their staff are backstabbers and love to create/spread rumors about other staff who are into themselves. Some staff lack teamwork and consideration which make the work stressful and unsafe. Most of the female staff would just watch other staff get attacked/hit by patients. Many of the staff are lazy, unsafe, immature, VERY unprofessional.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Huntington Beach, CA
pros: Set schedule. Solid team members
cons: Too much he said/she said drama; which management is involved in. Low pay for a great deal of work. If I didn’t get a lunch break for the day, they would put one in for me to not pay the extra time. CSU would have an average of 6 admits & 3 D/C’s per shift. They had us take aggressive patients when we didn’t have the ability to manage aggressive patients. Would get push back from inpatient if we tried to fill beds after 11pm or, if we over flowed a patient d/y acuity.

pros: Coworkers are great. Camaraderie is really good.
cons: The new staff training was short.

review_title: Coworkers are great to work with

review_title: Great Learning Environment for Psychiatric Nursing
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Cerritos, CA
pros: You learn a substantial amount about how to care for psychiatric patients whom range from having mild to severe illness. Health benefits are great now that they added Aetna. This is also an excellent place to start as a new graduate and has a good blend of both medical and psychiatric exposure. Starting is difficult at first as there's only three weeks of orientation/training before you're expected to work independently and you can have up to 24 patients alone on one medication cart, but most units are very supportive and it's a team-nursing environment.
cons: Pay isn't great, but it's competitive as a new graduate. Some units/shifts have a toxic culture which can promote a non-therapeutic milieu and make newer staff or staff floating from other units uncomfortable.

job_title: Per Diem Therapist in Long Beach, CA
pros: Important work for a greatly underserved population.
cons: Many full-time staff are burnt out. They clock in and then leave for several hours. Or bill the company for their commute time.

pros:

pros: Awesome staff members to work with

pros: I have worked here for the past 8 years and i love my co-workers. It is a diverse set of skills, experiences and personalities that keep this place interesting. I work at the Costa Mesa Location and it is for the most part a clean facility. You always feel that your staff will back you up and have your best interest. Plenty of hours and sometimes flexible schedule.
cons: For Mental Health Workers the pay is low some places start you out at the 16.00 range this place on the other hand starts you off in the fast food worker wage.  Every position here is low pay and you have to fight for overtime just so your paycheck can come out decent. Administration is more concerned on cutting costs and saving then fair pay and treatment of their staff. The RNs are consistently getting raises ( which I understand) but the rest of the staff are left in the wind with wage caps that are unfair. This is a acute care facility and we run the risk of assault and disease everyday with compensation that doesn't come close to being fair.

pros: 3 days of work for full time
cons: unsafe due to short staffing

pros: Learning experience was ok for new grads

review_title: Fast paced, challenging, you better be a quick learner.
pros: For anyone looking to earn hours (MFT/ACSW) there is individual and group supervision available.  It's actually excellent supervision.  The variety of patients you see will help the DSM come alive.  This is a definitely a place where you work with multiple professions and professionals.  Most of the staff that you work with are very friendly and easy going.  Leadership has consistently tried to protect the department from unfair treatment by other departments.
cons: High turnover rate in nursing, social work, management.  Pay seems to be a bit on the lower end of the scale.  Promotions are about 3% per year to follow inflation so essentially, you're not really getting a raise.  Potential for over time but depending on how much you value time vs money, it may or may not be worth the headache.  Burn out rate can be high so having new replacements all of the time can lead to problematic timing.

job_title: Activity Therapist in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: Great staff and flexible managers, good communication and the patients are wonderful to work with.  I've worked there per diem for 5 years and have never and any issues or problems.
cons: The therapy rooms are very small which makes it difficult to perform exercise groups.  Also, I haven't been given a raise in 5 years however I am only working per diem at College hospital.

pros: Great clients, good experience working with the mentally ill, flexibility in time you can come in for work or leave
cons: Toxic environment (no teamwork, unprofessional and disrespectful co-workers) and poor management. Micro-managing and lack of care and support from higher ups. The team ends up mirroring these attitudes and it trickles down to poor treatment of clients. They’ve lost a lot of great therapists as a result. Not an ideal place to be with professionals who act like professionals.

review_title: Good experience, but definitely not a place for career growth
pros:
Competitive pay for an internship position. 
Great experience working with a diverse client population, including severely mentally ill.
Experience working with a interdisciplinary treatment team.
cons:
No benefits or chance of raise in pay.
Very few opportunities to advance your career, even after getting licensed.
Group therapy is the only type of therapy you do.

job_title: Social Worker in Costa Mesa, CA
pros: I liked my co-workers, the staff treats the patients well and the location was close to where I live.
cons:
* training was very poor and if you make a mistake it's your fault.
* When you ask for clarification about an issue you don't always get an answer.
* Understaffed, especially on Saturdays.
* Upper management shows clear favoritism.
* Pay is not competitive especially for Per Diems.  You will get paid about what you would make if you worked at a SNF.

review_title: Good place to get hours and experience
pros: Great benefits, Great Pto, great experience. It is a great place to work just out of school with fairly good pay. The staff is wonderful, they welcome you into their lives and are very friendly.
cons: It is a high stress environment. There is a lot of love there but it can be difficult to disagree with the team. there are a lot of strong personalities. They can be rigid in their ways.

pros: Friendly environment, room for growth and opportunity for advancement, great coworkers, an amazing job that can be a career for some, flexible schedule/ hours.
cons: I haven't had any reason to not want to work their.

pros: A great team! Coworkers are very helpful, work great as a team
